de.tschebbischeff.math

Class Matrix3d

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.tschebbischeff.math.Matrix3d

  • public class Matrix3d
extends java.lang.Object
    Column-first Matrix implementation with double precision.
    Version:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    Tarek

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private double[][] data
      Stores the matrix data in a 3x3 array

    • Field Detail

      • data

        private double[][] data
        Stores the matrix data in a 3x3 array

    • Constructor Detail

      • Matrix3d

        public Matrix3d(double x1,
                double y1,
                double z1,
                double x2,
                double y2,
                double z2,
                double x3,
                double y3,
                double z3)
        Create a new matrix with the given values. The values are stored column-first, and in this constructor the values are listed in first row, then second row, then third row, from left to right.
        Parameters:
        x1 - Value for Row 1, Column 1.
        y1 - Value for Row 1, Column 2.
        z1 - Value for Row 1, Column 3.
        x2 - Value for Row 2, Column 1.
        y2 - Value for Row 2, Column 2.
        z2 - Value for Row 2, Column 3.
        x3 - Value for Row 3, Column 1.
        y3 - Value for Row 3, Column 2.
        z3 - Value for Row 3, Column 3.

      • Matrix3d

        public Matrix3d(Vector3d x,
                Vector3d y,
                Vector3d z)
        Creates a new matrix from three column vectors.
        Parameters:
        x - First column of the matrix.
        y - Second column of the matrix.
        z - Third column of the matrix.

      • Matrix3d

        public Matrix3d(double[][] m)
        Creates a new matrix from the given array. The first index of the array is saved as column. I.e. m[0] is the first column of the matrix, while {m[0][0], m[1][0], m[2][0]} would be the first row of the matrix.
        Parameters:
        m - A three by three array with the values for the matrix.

    • Method Detail

      • getData

        public double[][] getData()
        Gets the data of this matrix as a three by three array, with the first index describing the column.
        Returns:
        The column-first values as a double array.

      • identity

        public static Matrix3d identity()
        Returns an identity matrix, which's values are 0 on non-diagonal elements and 1 on diagonal elements.
        Returns:
        A new object of the identity matrix.

      • transpose

        public Matrix3d transpose()
        Transposes this matrix, by switching its rows and columns. I.e. each element is inserted into the position mirrored on the diagonal of the matrix.
        Returns:
        A new object containing a transposed matrix of this one.

      • mult

        public Matrix3d mult(Matrix3d b)
        Multiplies this matrix with a second matrix. As multiplication is not commutative this matrix is multiplied from the left with the second matrix b.
        Parameters:
        b - The matrix to multiply this matrix with.
        Returns:
        A new object containing the product of this and the second matrix b: this*b.

      • mult

        public Vector3d mult(Vector3d v)
        Multiplies this matrix with a vector of the same dimension. The matrix is multiplied from the left with the vector v.
        Parameters:
        v - The vector to multiply this matrix with.
        Returns:
        A new object containing the product of this matrix and the vector v: this*v.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString(int precision)
        Transforms this matrix into a readable padded format, while rounding to the specified number of digits behind the comma. Also pads with spaces from the left, depending on the number of digits of the highest number in the column.
        Parameters:
        precision - The number of digits behind the comma.
        Returns:
        A padded representation of the matrix.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Transforms this matrix into a readable padded format with three digits behind the comma. Also pads with spaces from the left, depending on the biggest number in each column of the matrix.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        The string representation of this matrix.
